intro: Packera zimapanica, commonly known as Zimapanica ragwort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of central Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or open habitats, often at high altitudes, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Its leaves are basal, rosette-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence. Packera zimapanica is of interest to botanists due to its ecological role and potential medicinal properties.
